statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Evan Fitzner set career highs with 20 points and nine rebounds to help Saint Mary's beat San Francisco 74-52 on Monday night in a West Coast Conference opener for both teams.
article.headline: Saint Mary's beats San Francisco 74-52 in WCC opener
article.linkText: Saint Mary's beats San Francisco 74-52 in WCC opener
article.story: MORAGA, Calif. -- Evan Fitzner set career highs with 20 points and nine rebounds to help Saint Mary's beat San Francisco 74-52 on Monday night in a West Coast Conference opener for both teams. Fitzner made four 3-pointers, and Emmett Naar made three more and finished with 13 points. Joe Rahon added 14 points for Saint Mary's (9-1), which made 10 of 23 from 3-point range. It's the seventh time this season the Gaels have hit double-digit 3s. The Gaels led by as many as 26, 70-44, after a layup by Rahon with 4:29 left in the second half and shot 50 percent from the field overall. Saint Mary's has won 24 of the last 26 meetings with San Francisco -- including a 17-game winning streak from 2006-14. Uche Ofoegbu led San Francisco (6-5) with 13 points. The Dons were held to 17-of-60 shooting (28.3 percent).
